info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:03PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...
Sabine River Near Gladewater affecting Upshur, Gregg, Smith and Wood Counties.
For the Sabine River...including Mineola, Hawkins, Gladewater, Longview, Beckville, Logansport...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Sabine River near Gladewater.
* WHEN...From Sunday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Lowland flooding will continue to slowly decrease over the next several days.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 31.8 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 31.7 feet on 03/09/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 915 PM CDT.
